sprint_goal: Establish foundational security, user management, and all core master data models (Vehicle, Driver, Customer, Route, Material) to enable subsequent feature development.
epic_coverage: User and Access Management, Core Module Setup & Master Data, Audit & Compliance
key_deliverables: Functional RBAC system; CRUD for all master data; Basic audit trail on core models.
demo_objectives: Admin creates a user and assigns a role; Admin creates a vehicle, driver, and customer; Show audit trail in chatter for a changed record.
success_criteria: All master data models are stable; RBAC framework is in place; All ACs for planned stories are met.
risk_factors: Complexity of getting RBAC record rules correct from the start.
mitigation_strategies: Early peer review of all security XML files and extensive testing with multiple roles.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 15 points completed by end of week 1.

sprint_name: Sprint 2: Core Trip Workflow & Driver Portal MVP
sprint_goal: Complete the core operational trip lifecycle from creation to delivery confirmation, and enable drivers to log in and view their assignments.
epic_coverage: Trip Lifecycle Management, Driver Portal, Core Module Setup & Master Data
key_deliverables: Trip creation and assignment workflow; Driver login to a mobile portal; Driver ability to start a trip and upload POD.
demo_objectives: Dispatch Manager creates and assigns a trip; Driver logs in on a mobile device, sees the trip, starts it, then marks it as 'Delivered' by uploading a POD.
success_criteria: The core trip lifecycle from 'Planned' to 'Delivered' is fully functional and demo-ready; Driver portal is accessible and usable on mobile.
risk_factors: Complexity of custom OWL components for the driver portal (RISK-004); Ensuring robust server-side validation for all driver actions.
mitigation_strategies: Early prototyping of driver UI and regular feedback sessions; Rigorous testing of backend endpoints for driver actions.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 17 points completed by end of week 1.

sprint_goal: Implement the full expense management loop from driver submission to manager approval/rejection, and establish the real-time event logging and system-wide notification framework.
epic_coverage: Driver Portal, Financial Management & Invoicing, Alerts & Card Management, Trip Lifecycle Management
key_deliverables: Driver expense submission with receipt upload; Manager approval/rejection queue; System notification service (in-app & email); Trip event logging and halt/resume workflow.
demo_objectives: Driver submits a diesel expense with odometer reading; Manager views the expense in the queue, approves one, and rejects another with a reason; Driver logs an 'Accident' event, trip status changes to 'On Hold', and manager is notified.
success_criteria: End-to-end expense workflow is functional; Notification framework is operational and can deliver alerts for critical events.
risk_factors: Complexity of real-time notifications via Odoo Bus; Robustness of file uploads from mobile devices over variable networks.
mitigation_strategies: Use a centralized notification service to decouple logic; Implement client-side validation and clear error handling for file uploads.
external_dependencies: SMTP server configuration for email notifications.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 17 points completed by end of week 1.

sprint_goal: Deliver the complete financial settlement cycle, from GST e-invoicing to payment recording, and enable trip and vehicle profitability analysis.
epic_coverage: Financial Management & Invoicing, Alerts & Card Management
key_deliverables: GST-compliant e-invoicing with GSP integration; Resilient failure handling for e-invoicing; Payment recording against invoices; Customer ledger view; Trip & Vehicle profitability calculations.
demo_objectives: Finance Officer generates a draft invoice from a completed trip; Officer generates a compliant e-invoice via GSP integration; Simulate a GSP failure and show the manual intervention workflow; Record a partial payment against an invoice; Show the updated trip profitability.
success_criteria: The trip-to-cash cycle is fully functional and compliant; Profitability calculations are accurate and reflect approved expenses.
risk_factors: High dependency on external GSP API stability and documentation (RISK-001); Complexity of the sync/async fallback mechanism for e-invoicing.
mitigation_strategies: Early and thorough integration with GSP sandbox; Implement robust logging and alerting around the GSP client; Prioritize the manual intervention workflow as a contingency.
external_dependencies: GSP API sandbox environment must be available and stable.
integration_windows: Integration testing with GSP sandbox throughout the sprint.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 16 points completed by end of week 1.

sprint_goal: Deliver real-time fleet visibility via maps and geofencing, and provide a high-level operational dashboard for managers.
epic_coverage: GPS Tracking & Real-Time Monitoring, Dashboards & Reporting
key_deliverables: GPS data ingestion pipeline; Real-time map view of in-transit vehicles; Geofence creation and management UI; Automated geofence entry/exit alerts; Manager dashboard with core operational KPIs.
demo_objectives: Show the live map with moving vehicle markers; Admin creates a geofence around a destination; Simulate a vehicle entering the geofence and show the resulting alert; Showcase the manager dashboard with Vehicle Status and Delayed Trips KPIs.
success_criteria: Live map updates within the 60s latency requirement; Geofence alerts are triggered reliably; Dashboard provides an accurate, at-a-glance operational overview.
risk_factors: Technical complexity of the real-time data pipeline (RISK-002); Performance of the map UI with many vehicles.
mitigation_strategies: Early load testing of the data pipeline; Frontend performance optimization for map rendering.
external_dependencies: Third-party GPS Provider API must be available.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 16 points completed by end of week 1.

sprint_goal: Activate the dashboard alert system with all triggers and deliver the first suite of operational reports with export functionality.
key_deliverables: Fully functional dashboard alerts panel; Automated alerts for document expiry, license expiry, and low card balance; Operational reports (Trip, Vehicle Utilization, etc.); Report export to PDF/Excel.
demo_objectives: Show a dashboard with multiple alert types; Acknowledge an alert; Generate a Trip Report for the last month; Export the generated report to both Excel and PDF.
success_criteria: All defined alert conditions trigger notifications correctly; Operational reports are accurate and can be exported.
risk_factors: Performance of reporting queries on large datasets; Complexity of generating well-formatted PDF and Excel files.
mitigation_strategies: Optimize database queries with indexes; Use established libraries for file generation.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 15 points completed by end of week 1.

sprint_goal: Complete the advanced financial and performance reporting suite and provide system configuration options for administrators.
key_deliverables: Financial Reports (Aging, Customer Revenue); Profitability Reports (Vehicle, Detailed Expense); System settings page for admins; Configurable session timeout.
demo_objectives: Generate the Customer Aging report; Generate the Vehicle Profitability report; Admin changes the session timeout value in the settings page and shows it takes effect.
success_criteria: All key financial and performance reports are functional and accurate; System parameters can be configured by an Admin.
risk_factors: Accuracy of complex financial calculations in reports; Security of the session timeout implementation.
mitigation_strategies: Involve finance stakeholders in UAT for report validation; Thorough security review and testing of session management logic.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 17 points completed by end of week 1.

sprint_goal: Finalize all reporting, execute and validate the one-time data migration from the legacy system, and prepare the system for production go-live.
key_deliverables: Data migration scripts (ETL); Data migration validation report script; Final performance reports (Driver, Fuel); Successful completion of a full dry-run in staging.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate the execution of the migration dry-run; Showcase the generated validation report, highlighting matching record counts and financial totals; Show the final Driver Performance and Fuel Efficiency reports.
success_criteria: Migration dry-run is completed and validated with sign-off from the Admin; All user stories are complete and have passed QA.
risk_factors: Poor quality of legacy data delaying migration (RISK-003); Performance of migration scripts on the full dataset.
mitigation_strategies: Have a dedicated data cleansing phase if the dry-run reveals significant issues; Allocate buffer time in the final cutover plan.
external_dependencies: Final, complete data extract from the legacy system.
integration_windows: Final UAT and performance testing window.
burndown_target: Focus on migration script stability early in the sprint.
